result.execSummary:
The defendant Lacy R. Storkson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger management and any other treatment or educational programming ordered by the agent.

Serve 6 months conditional jail time, with work release/huber, and stayed until on or before July 1, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

Credit in the event of revocation:  0 days.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: With work release/huber and stayed until on or before July 1, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: RCSD - Disposition of Warrant or Commitment (Time Served)

Defendant Lacy R. Storkson in court, in custody, with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA informs the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolutiong calling for def plea to count 1 for dismissal/read in of the remaining two charges.  Def pleas no contest to count 1.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  3 years probation with conditions to include costs, anger mgt treatment and any other educational programming as ordered by the agent.  Conditional jail time:  6 months, stayed 30 days until on or before 7/1/16 between 6-7 a.m.  Credit in the event of revocation:  0 days.
